{"id":1007711783,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"2Â months","timestamp":1690722026,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"41 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1007711783/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Median of Two Sorted Arrays","memory":"90 MB","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n    double findMedianSortedArrays(vector<int>& nums1, vector<int>& nums2) {\n        vector <int> ans;\n        int n1=nums1.size(),n2=nums2.size();\n        int i=0,j=0;\n\n        while(i!=n1 && j!=n2){\n            if(nums1[i]<nums2[j]){\n                ans.push_back(nums1[i]);\n                i++;\n            }\n            else{\n                ans.push_back(nums2[j]);\n                j++;\n            }\n        }\n\n        while(i!=n1){\n            ans.push_back(nums1[i]);\n            i++;\n        }\n\n        while(j!=n2){\n            ans.push_back(nums2[j]);\n            j++;\n        }\n\n        int n=ans.size();\n        double a;\n        if(n&1){\n            int m=n/2;\n            a=ans[m];\n        }\n        else{\n            int m1=n/2;\n            int m2=n/2-1;\n            a=(ans[m1]+ans[m2])/(2*1.0);\n        }\n        \n        return a;\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"median-of-two-sorted-arrays","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
